bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Telegram from Tom D. Spies to Philip Showalter Hench, December 26, 1951

div1.p: Spies urgently requests a copy of Hench's speech so that it can be translated into Spanish.

div1.head: Telegram from Tom D. Spies to Philip Showalter Hench, December 26, 1951
div1.opener:
WESTERN
UNION
W. P. MARSHALL, PRESIDENT
CLASS OF SERVICE
----
This is a full-rate
Telegram or Cable-
gram unless its de-
ferred character is in-
dicated by a suitable
symbol above or pre-
ceding the address.
1201
(58)..
__________________________________________________
The filing time shown in the date line on telegrams and day letters is STANDARD TIME at point of origin. Time of receipt is STANDARD TIME at point of destination
MA079 NSB055
NS.BMB103 DL PD=BIRMINGHAM ALA 26 945A=
1951 DEC 26 AM 11 07
DR PHILLIPS S HENCH= MAYO CLINIC ROCHESTER MINN=
div1.p:
WILL YOU AIR MAIL ORIGINAL AND COPY OF YOUR SPEECH AS YOU
AND ONE OTHER ARE THE ONLY ONES HOLDING UP THE CUBAN
TRANSLATION HOPE THIS DOESNT COME AT AN ESPECIALLY BAD TIME=
div1.closer: :TOM SPIES= THE COMPANY WILL APPRECIATE SUGGESTIONS FROM ITS PATRONS CONCERNING ITS SERVICE
